About the UO Team




The UO SPL is a cross-disciplinary research and evaluation lab that
includes expertise from fields including suicide prevention, education,
mental health, prevention science, public health, implementation
science. In addition to these fields, the UO SPL is dedications to
partnering with groups that have been historically marginalized (e.g.,
Black, Indigenous, People of Color, LGBTQIA+) and ensuring that all
research and evaluation activities incorporate perspectives from a
diverse group of key stakeholders.
UO SPL members are trained to contribute to co-design and innovative
solutions through partnering with practitioners, and have expertise in a
range of quantitative and qualitative research methodologies.

Strengthening Mental Health in Education
2.0
Program Evaluation, University of Oregon




This website is for disseminating evaluation reports and findings
produced by the Suicide Prevention Lab at the University of Oregon.
For more information about this project, please read the
documentation at https://www.oregon.gov/ode/students-and-family/equity/SchoolSafety/Pages/Strengthening-Mental-Health-in-Education.aspx.
